tooltip.category_header: What does high, medium, or low means ?

category_content.content: indicates a major change to the stakeholder group’s way of working with significant risk to go live without engagement and education.
tells us that there is some change to the stakeholder group's way of working and some behavioral change; intended benefits may not be achieved without engagement.
means that stakeholder groups need to be aware of the change, but that there may be limited impact or requirements for them to do anything differently.
(Not shown) indicates that the stakeholder group will experience no change to this aspect of their role.

organizationStructure.content: How an organization is defined and managed
Spans of control, the number of organizational levels, informs chains of command, approvals required to make day-to-day decisions or classification of tax status

leadership.content: Level of leadership involvement required for change
Leadership involvement to reinforce change directly or indirectly, leaders directly driving change, changes in leadership behavior or actions or leadership sponsorship is required

culture.content: Change to behaviors and way of working

New behaviors of people required to complete and support the processes, different way-of-working that will require people to act in a different way or change in the way success and performance are measured

interaction.content: The means by which information and knowledge are exchanged in the organization

The frequency, quality and clarity of information flow, the interaction exchange and decision making within/across functional groups or the mode in which the employees share information with each other

workload.content: Changes in the amount of work required as part of individual roles
Quantity of work per individual employee, time required for roles responsibilities, the number and types is steps in the work process or who performs the tasks/steps

skillsAndKnowledge.content: The special knowledge, skills or capabilities required of the workforce to effectively perform their jobs
Specialized skills required for specific new tasks, tools and job aids needed/provided, management/supervisory/leadership skills or exisiting training support

systemsReporting.content: The extent to which new tools and functionality are introduced to the business and/or the extent to which legacy systems or external customers are impacted and the new system’s performance based on usage
Includes new system and/or reporting processes. Changes in interaction, employees responsibilities and updated processes to send and receive information.

analytics.content: The extent in which data is available and how it is used
Additional storage requirement and capabilities are necessary; additional data, both historical and current, must be made available; methods in which data is used to provide actionable insights

tools.content: New supporting resources needing to be used to perform ones job and/or function.

security.content: The way that people need to act to protect our data, tools and assets against threats
Cybersecurity, Data protection, Hardware, Software, Data landscape, Integrations.

rolesAndResponsibilities.content: The roles, responsibilities and/authorities assigned to specific jobs within an organization
Levels of authority, responsibility, and / or power; organization of work groups; conditions under which jobs are performed; or, performance requirements, standards, and measurement criteria

policiesAndProcedure.content: Formal and informal organizational guidelines for daily work activities.
Legislation, business procedures and policies, administrative procedures and policies, measurement standards and criteria or quality standards and criteria

waysOfWorking.content: The way in which work is performed and how to perform it.

typeNewResource.content: Allows all projects within the platform to leverage the materials that are added via this resource.
Will only be viewable at this project and cannot be access by other teams that may leverage this instance of the platform.

tooltip.restrictedAccess: If a project is restricted, no practitioners outside of the project will be able to view this data
tooltip.commaSeparated: Items must be separated by a comma
tooltip.orgCommaSeparated: For organizational purposes, separate new items by commas
tooltip.createPhases: Phases are customizable for each project. Phases will be viewable on the timeline.
tooltip.createCourseOwner: The owner of a course is responsible for the design, build, and review of that course. Not necessarily the person delivering the training.
tooltip.createCourseWorkstream: Defined by the project, workstream represents a subgroup of your team or a business area. For changes to this list, reach out to your admin.
tooltip.offeringsTip: To edit the offerings go to the schedule tab and click “Manage Offerings”.
tooltip.recStakeholder: Based on the change impacts associated with the courses selected in the previous step.
tooltip.workstreamInfo: Defined by the project, workstream represents a subgroup of your team or a business area. For changes to this list, reach out to your admin.
tooltip.workingSessionLocation: How / where the meeting will be hosted

createOutcome.headline: Your Headline, or title should be as detailed as possible as well as quantifiable in order to be measurable.
createOutcome.category: Determine whether one of the existing 360° Value Meter categories or a custom category best suits this outcome.
